definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
early to bed, early to rise/to keep early hours

sentences.english: I like to garden , do you like to sleep-in in the mornings or get up early ?
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢到花园，你喜欢睡在早晨或早起？

sentences.english: I co ider it a good habit to get up early.
sentences.chinese: 我认为早起是个好习惯。

sentences.english: To help you on your way to becoming an early riser try getting things ready the night before.
sentences.chinese: 在前天晚上就把事情打理好有助你成为早起者。

sentences.english: Do you hate people that are happy and chipper early in the morning?
sentences.chinese: 你是否极度嫉妒那些早起并且保持良好状态的人？

sentences.english: Many older adults tend to get sleepier earlier in the evening and awaken earlier in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人倾向于早睡早起。

sentences.english: You can sleep and wake up early perfectly fine by changing other habits.
sentences.chinese: 你可能通过其它的习惯早睡早起。

sentences.english: Make coffee or tea in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 早起时为爱人泡杯咖啡或茶。

sentences.english: His habit was to get up early and have a cold bath.
sentences.chinese: 他的习惯是每天早起然后洗一个冷水浴。

sentences.english: This is how the early church grew.
sentences.chinese: 早起教会就是这样成长的。

sentences.english: The early bird catches the worm .
Jack stole a match on Bill, and got the job by getting up earlier.
sentences.chinese: 杰克悄悄占先一步，比比尔早起而抡到了这份工作。

sentences.english: Early to bed, early to rise, our energy is limited, everything need to be balances.
sentences.chinese: 早睡，早起，每一个人的精力有限，必须要平衡。

sentences.english: My boy friend rephrased it as, it’s the early worm that gets caught.
sentences.chinese: 它到我男友那就成了“早起的虫儿会被吃”。

sentences.english: I need to teach my early-rising toddler when morning has truly broken.
sentences.chinese: 破晓确实来临时，我需要教我蹒跚学步的孩子早起。

sentences.english: I realize that when the weather’s cool it’s really tough to start getting up earlier.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，当天气渐冷时，开始稍稍早起确实很难。

sentences.english: Ann: Yeah, it’s cold enough that I can’t wake up earlier.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，冷得我都早起不来了。

definition: to get out of bed/to get up
early to bed, early to rise/to keep early hours
to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
make your day's plan early in the morning (idiom)/early morning is the golden time of the day
pinyin: yi1 ri4 zhi1 ji4 zai4 yu2 chen2

definition: matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
